page.title: 01WEST LEOMINSTER DISTRICT
page.content: This area, including outskirts of Leominster, is predominantly rural, with some housing - both private and council - but is in the main sparsely populated, with isolated cottages and farmhouses and occasional hamlets such as Cholstrey and Cobnash. The agriculture consists of pastureland, arable land and orcharding. The rivers Lugg and Arrow and Pinsley Brook flow through the area. Leisure pursuits are mainly rural. The main occupation is farming, although residents on the estates, situated at the eastern edge, travel to work in Leominster and Hereford. There is a fair amount of unemployment in the area. Public transport is not very good, relying almost entirely on private bus companies.
